result.execSummary:
The defendant Timothy M. Gaines was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Child Abuse-Intentionally Cause Harm, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.03(2)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: THE DEPARTMENT OF CORRECTIONS SHALL DEDUCT RESTITUTION AND ALL OTHER COURT OBLIGATIONS AT THE RATE OF 25% OF ALL MONIES RECEIVED WHILE INCARCERATED.
NOTE: If the Defendant's Probation is revoked, the conditions of Extended Supervision shall be the same as the conditions of Probation.

miscConds.notes:
Pay court costs.  **NOTE: THE DEFENDANT IS ORDERED TO PAY ALL COURT OBLIGATIONS TO THE CLERK OF COURTS OFFICE.   Payment is due within 30 days.  If the Defendant cannot make the payment, he/she must report to the Clerk of Courts Office to set up a payment plan.  Failure to comply will result in other collection methods including a civil Judgment and/or suspension of your drivers license for two (2) years.  This judgment may be collected by income assignment if you fail to pay fines and costs as ordered.
----------------------------

IT IS HEREBY ORDERED THAT the defendant's excess work release funds be applied to any & all outstanding Court obligations while serving his mandatory jail sentence.
----------------------------

Provide biological specimen to state crime lab for DNA analysis, and pay DNA analysis surcharge. Complete all other programming as deemed appropriate by the Compas assessment, and the Department of Corrections.   The defendant must pay Department of Corrections Supervision fees.

timeConds.notes: with work release privileges to commence forthwith. NOTE: The Court STAYS three (3) months of the conditional release jail time for use by the Agent.

Defendant Timothy M. Gaines in court with attorney Larry D. Steen.  Valerian A. Powell appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
**NOTE: Court Reporter A.M. - Eileen Grzenia; Court Reporter P.M. - Sandy Elderbrook  Sentencing hearing scheduled for February 5, 2015 at 02:30 pm.
Notice of Videotaped Statement of a Child, Offer of Proof, and Request for Hearing
Notice of Videotaped Statement of a Child, Offer of Proof, and Request for Hearing

Defendant Timothy M. Gaines in court with attorney Larry D. Steen.  Valerian A. Powell appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Matter is before the Court for a Final pre-trial.  Attorney Steen advises the matter is ready to proceed to trial on Monday.  He does not have any pre-trial Motions at this time.  Attorney Powell files a Notice of Videotaped Statement of Child and the CD recording of that interview with the Court.  He indicates that the Court will need to review this video and rule on its admissibility prior to trial.  There is another CD recording of an interview with another child which Attorney Powell does not yet have in his possession.  Parties have had discussions with regard to possible resolution of this case.  Matter remains on for trial on Monday, December 1st.  If the parties reach an agreement, they can ask to have this added to the 1:15 Call on Wednesday, November 26th.  State can have its Jury Instructions filed with the Court by noon on Wednesday.  Court asks that the parties be present for the trial at 8:30 a.m. on Monday morning.  Minutes filed.

Defendant Timothy M. Gaines in court with attorney Larry D. Steen.  Valerian A. Powell appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Matter before the Court on State's Motion to Introduce Other Acts. Court grants motion in reference to "slapping" and hold in abeyance any ruling on the alleged incident in paragraph 7 until more specific information is provided. Minutes filed.

Defendant Timothy M. Gaines in court with attorney Larry D. Steen.  Valerian A. Powell appeared for the State of Wisconsin. No agreement. Matter set for State's Motion to Introduce Other Acts and Jury trial. Mintues filed.  Motion hearing scheduled for September 5, 2014 at 10:30 am.  Final pre-trial scheduled for November 24, 2014 at 02:30 pm.  Jury trial - 12 person scheduled for December 1, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Timothy M. Gaines in court with attorney Larry D Steen.  Haley J Rea appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court in session @ 2:00 p.m. Appearances made. 
State calls Officer Jeremy Ruby who is duly sworn and responds to direct exam of ADA Rea.

Court finds probable cause and binds the defendnat over for trial. State files Information - reading waived.  Status conference scheduled for August 13, 2014 at 01:15 pm.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Timothy M. Gaines in court with attorney Larry D Steen.  Haley J Rea appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Minutes filed. Preliminary hearing requested.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 9, 2014 at 02:00 pm.

Defendant Timothy M. Gaines appeared, Estee E Scholtz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Minutes filed. Defendant will retain an attorney.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for May 28, 2014 at 01:15 pm.
Signed bond filed with the court.

Defendant will not in any way contact or attempt to contact any victim(s) listed and will avoid their residence/place of employment or any place they are located and will avoid causing any other person, other than defendant's attorney, from doing so on defendant's behalf.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as through the mail, by telephone, by way of electronic device, in person, or through a third party.  VICTIM(S)/RESIDENCE(S): NO CONTACT WITH C.J.D. (04-20-2010) OR HIS IMMEDIATE FAMILY OR RESIDENCE @ W1438 HIGHWAY B, GENOA CITY, WIL. NO CONTACT WITH J.D.,(GRANDFATHER OF VICTIM).  If defendant and victim(s) are living together, defendant may go to their residence once with a police officer to retrieve the defendant's personal belongings.  Defendant shall personally ensure that payments are made under any Order for Income Withholding if the Court appoints an attorney for the defendant.
